summary: The Auto Theft Prevention Act aims to provide funding to state and local law enforcement agencies to combat auto theft and stolen vehicle trafficking. The bill establishes an auto theft prevention grant program administered by the Department of Justice, allocating funds based on a state's auto theft rate. Funding can be used for equipment purchases, hiring staff, training, and data collection. The bill also amends existing legislation to allow for the use of existing grant funds for auto theft prevention. The bill authorizes appropriations of $30 million annually from 2026-2030.
